title.narrative: FLC: APNAC / Towards a Corrupt Free Zambia

description.narrative: The 2015?2016 project aims to build upon APNAC Zambia?s previous activities implemented during the last grant from the Finnish Embassy. This is in an effort to provide continuation of programmes and ensure sustainability. A specific focus will be on advoca cy work based on research on legislation carried out during the previous FLC project. During the project APNAC Zambia will undertake activities under two main outcome areas as part of the organisation strategic focus 2014-2017. Firstly APNAC recognises tha t coalitions have particular relevance for enhancing parliaments as anti-corruption forces. Where such coalitions are in place anti-corruption legislators can depend on a base of support for their activities and wield a powerful political weapon as they co nfront corrupt practices. Through engagement of political parties CSOs and media the expected final outcome is a strong advocacy base for APNAC due to support from different identified stakeholders as well as a strengthened platform for MPs to operate from . The activities will involve training of leaders of political parties party youth and media as well as discussion forums with like-minded organisations to identify ways in which joint activities may be undertaken. Secondly APNAC endeavours to enhance the effectiveness of its operations through further strengthening the capacity of parliamentarians to engage with corruption issues. Activities will involve training on evidence-based advocacy and international protocols as well as orientation of new members. The primary beneficiary group is the approx. 100 members as well as media and CSO representatives. The activities will mainly take place around the capital Lusaka.
